movie_title: How names can tell painful stories ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: Can names be attached to painful histories? Neil and Beth discuss this and teach you some useful voc

vocabulary.definition: the distinguishing character or personality of an individual
vocabulary.example: Our identity is closely linked to our name.

vocabulary.definition: a situation lacking fairness or justice
vocabulary.example: Historical injustices may lead to a desire to change one's name.
John Anderson was considered a noble missionary.

vocabulary.definition: beliefs and feelings that influence how someone thinks, often outdated or unhelpful
vocabulary.example: Bishop Jeremiah mentioned the baggage associated with his name.

vocabulary.definition: to have a particular meaning or importance for someone
vocabulary.example: I could never find a name that truly resonated with me.
People may speak truth to power to resist oppressive forces.
